intro: Bartsia camporum, commonly known as the camp orchid, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Bartsia camporum is often found growing in association with other plants, forming part of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
